title: Space-Farm Biodome Adventure #7
goal: Solve the puzzles, achieve the main objective, and escape.

rooms.name: Hydroponics Bay
rooms.description: A vast chamber filled with rows of vertical growing towers bathed in purple LED light. Plants of all kinds grow in nutrient-rich water solutions. The air is humid and smells of fresh vegetation mixed with recycled oxygen. Through the transparent dome ceiling, you can see the stars and the curve of Earth below. Warning lights blink on several control panels.

items.name: botanist work station
items.description: A cluttered desk with plant samples, data tablets, and growing charts scattered across its surface

items.name: research log tablet
items.description: A digital tablet containing the botanist's research notes
items.text: Dr. Sarah Kim's Log - Day 847: The biodome has been operational since 2089. Our wheat crop yield is up 23%! Chief Engineer Rodriguez maintains the life support systems perfectly. Remember: emergency protocols require knowledge of key personnel and systems. The supply locker code is our founding year.

items.name: supply storage locker
items.description: A metal locker with a four-digit combination lock and biohazard warning labels

items.name: security access card
items.description: A magnetic keycard labeled 'ENVIRONMENTAL CONTROL ACCESS'

items.name: maintenance manual
items.description: A technical manual for biodome systems
items.text: BIODOME MAINTENANCE MANUAL: All atmospheric systems controlled from Environmental Control Center. Chief Engineer: Carlos Rodriguez. Lead Botanist: Dr. Sarah Kim. Emergency evacuation via airlock requires proper authorization. Oxygen is generated through photosynthesis in the hydroponics bay.

items.name: growing tower alpha
items.description: A tall vertical tower with wheat plants growing in hydroponic solution
items.text: Tower Alpha Status: Wheat crop - 98% healthy. Nutrient levels optimal. This tower produces oxygen for the entire biodome through photosynthesis.

items.name: tool cabinet
items.description: A cabinet containing gardening and maintenance tools

items.name: small brass key
items.description: A key labeled 'SAMPLE STORAGE'

items.name: locked sample storage box
items.description: A refrigerated box for storing plant samples and seeds

items.name: crew assignment roster
items.description: A document listing all biodome personnel and their roles
items.text: BIODOME CREW ROSTER: Chief Engineer Carlos Rodriguez - Life Support Systems. Lead Botanist Dr. Sarah Kim - Agricultural Operations. Technician James Park - Maintenance. All emergency procedures coordinated by Chief Engineer Rodriguez.

items.name: pressure door to control center
items.description: A reinforced door with a card reader leading to the Environmental Control Center

rooms.name: Environmental Control Center
rooms.description: The nerve center of the biodome's life support systems. Banks of monitors display atmospheric composition, temperature, pressure, and crop health data. A large window overlooks the hydroponics bay below. Control panels line the walls, their screens glowing with real-time telemetry. The hum of air processors fills the room.

items.name: main control console
items.description: The primary control station with multiple displays showing biodome systems
items.text: SYSTEM STATUS: Oxygen generation: OPTIMAL. Temperature: 22°C. Pressure: 101.3 kPa. All systems nominal. Emergency airlock accessible from this level. Chief Engineer Rodriguez last logged in 6 hours ago.

items.name: atmospheric monitoring station
items.description: A specialized console tracking air quality and composition
items.text: ATMOSPHERIC ANALYSIS: O2: 21%, N2: 78%, CO2: 0.04%. Oxygen production source: Hydroponics Bay photosynthesis. Air quality: EXCELLENT. System has maintained perfect balance since 2089.

items.name: chief engineer's desk
items.description: A desk covered with technical schematics and system reports

items.name: handwritten note
items.description: A note in Chief Engineer Rodriguez's handwriting
items.text: Reminder to self: The emergency airlock security system requires verification of three critical facts: Who manages life support? Where is oxygen generated? Who coordinates emergencies? Only authorized personnel should know these answers. - C.R.

items.name: emergency protocol manual
items.description: A red binder containing emergency evacuation procedures
items.text: EMERGENCY EVACUATION PROTOCOL: In case of critical system failure, proceed to emergency airlock on this level. Airlock access requires security verification. All emergency operations coordinated by Chief Engineer Carlos Rodriguez. Ensure all personnel are accounted for before evacuation.

items.name: emergency supply cabinet
items.description: A cabinet stocked with emergency equipment and supplies

items.name: EVA suit helmet
items.description: A helmet for extravehicular activity, required for airlock use

items.name: portable oxygen tank
items.description: A backup oxygen supply for emergencies

items.name: biodome schematic
items.description: A large diagram showing the biodome's layout and systems
items.text: BIODOME SCHEMATIC: Level 1 - Hydroponics Bay (Oxygen Generation). Level 2 - Environmental Control Center (Life Support Management). Emergency Airlock - East Wing. All systems interconnected and monitored from central control.

items.name: emergency airlock door
items.description: A heavy airlock door with a security terminal displaying three verification questions. Red emergency lighting frames the entrance.

password_questions.question: Who manages the life support systems?
password_questions.hint: Check the crew roster and maintenance manual

password_questions.question: Where is oxygen generated?
password_questions.hint: The atmospheric monitor and maintenance guide explain the oxygen source

password_questions.question: Who coordinates emergency operations?
password_questions.hint: The emergency procedures manual identifies who leads evacuations

rooms.name: Emergency Escape Airlock
rooms.description: You've reached the emergency airlock! A small chamber with a rescue pod docked on the other side of the outer door. Through the porthole, you can see the rescue vessel's lights blinking, ready for departure. The airlock's systems show green across the board. Safety harnesses hang on the wall, and the evacuation checklist is complete.

items.name: emergency rescue pod
items.description: A small spacecraft designed for emergency evacuation to the nearest space station

items.name: airlock control panel
items.description: The panel controlling the airlock cycle, showing all systems ready
items.text: AIRLOCK STATUS: Inner door sealed. Outer door ready. Rescue pod docked and pressurized. All systems GO for evacuation.

items.name: observation porthole
items.description: A thick window showing the rescue pod and the stars beyond

rooms.win_message: SUCCESS! You board the rescue pod and initiate the departure sequence. The airlock cycles, and the pod detaches from the biodome. As you pilot away, you look back at the biodome floating against Earth's blue curve - a testament to human ingenuity in space. You've successfully escaped and are heading to safety. You win!
